Event.EventDescription: Switch on your science at Sprout Eden to celebrate the start of National Science Week 2013.Come along for cake and coffee and take part in science activities, including games and quizzes. Places are limited, call the Discovery Centre on 02 6496 1699 to book your table now.

A whole school afternoon session on invertebrates with a guest speaker, then community members will be invited to a small dinner prepared by some of our students with another presentation by our guest speaker.

Event.EventCategory: Science & Technology ~ Human Body and Movement
Event.EventDescription: Nowra High School Science Fair will involve students from Kindergarten to Yr 10 from a range of local schools, from Berry to Ulladulla on the South Coast of NSW, presenting their projects (experiments, models and scientific literacy) for judging.

We are creating a Sensory Garden for students in Grades Prep-2 to give them the opportunity to design, create and explore with members of the broader school community. The garden is to become the focus for conversations with parents, Latrobe Community Health Members and Monash students.
Year 6 at Mt Kuring-gai Public School are running a Science Show! There will be crazy scientists, slippery slime, banana dna extraction, rockets and many more exciting experiments.
Two guest speakers talking about their interst and careers in science.
Event.EventPayment: $5 - $10 per person to cover the cost of afternoon tea (cost yet to be advised by catering).

Event.EventDescription: Are you interested in weather and climate and climate change? What is the difference between weather and climate? How do we forecast the weather? What drives your local climate? Is climate change real and what are the implications?

Event.EventDescription: A day of science related activities with up to seven schools competing.

Event.EventDescription: Explore Science @ TSC is a 5 day event exploring Tertiary and career pathways in Science. Various speakers will visit Thebarton to present to students.

Event.EventDescription: Astonishing science at the shops! See science demonstrations with liquid nitrogen, rockets and extraordinary experiments with ordinary items - you can even try them at home - or get hands-on as you create and build with the Gravity Gizmo Challenge and other activities! Great family fun.

The Science Centre has recently re-landscaped its outdoor areas to allow for open air events. On several evenings during National Science Week a spectacular outdoor laser concert - suitable for all ages - will be preceeded by an explanation and demonstration of the use of lasers in society.

Event.EventDescription: Prep through to Year 12 students will be taking part in lunch activities throughout National Science Week.

The EcoFair schools day is an event available to all Centralian Schools. On the day we will be running 6 different workshops as well as bring the amazing Miss Amelia Telford to present to the students.

Brain damage was considered a permanent injury, according to relatively recently in neuroscience. The remarkable regenerative abilities of the brain, however, are increasingly being documented and explored by scientists. Australia is at the forefront of much of this research.

Venue.VenueStreetName: North-Science Road Off Clunnies Ross Street

Event.EventDescription: A community event to celebrate and learn more in our Outdoor Learning Area. Several stations will be set up providing students and community members with the opportunity to discover more about invertebrates in our school.

Event.EventName: Do fish cross roads? Does a fish need a ladder?
Event.EventDescription: Showcase local science and engineering designs that ensure our small native fish, platypus and Tassie’s freshwater lobster (largest invertebrate in the world) can pass through fast-flowing road culverts - solving a real-world problem with an innovative solution.

Science, Medicine & Health at ANU recently held a photography competition for students and staff and threw out the challenge to ‘capture science’ - to think of different ways to interpret science. The results were so wonderful we wanted to share them with the whole of Canberra.
Event.EventPayment: Admission to the exhibition at Questacon is included in the usual entry fee.

Event.EventName: Super Science Spectacular and Maths Madness Problem Solving Challenge
Event.EventDescription: Teams of Year 8/9 students from secondary schools across the region are invited to do battle over a series of mind-twisting, brain-bending maths and science problems.

Event.EventName: Little Einsteins Early Learning Centre Leumeah Brain Break Morning Tea
Event.EventDescription: We will be hosting a morning tea for the children and families that attend our centre. We would also like to invite community members to join us if they wish. The children will discuss newly skills acquired realtion to scientific experimentation.
